list_definition.definition: to bend (the head and often also the upper part of the body) forwards in greeting a person etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They bowed their heads in prayer.
I bow to your superior knowledge.
He made a bow to the ladies.

list_definition.definition: a springy curved rod bent by a string, by which arrows are shot
a rod with horsehair stretched along it, by which the strings of a violin etc are sounded.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her dress is decorated with bows.

list_definition.definition: the front of a ship or boat

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The waves broke over the bows.

list_ex_of_english: To first order with respect to the slenderness parameter, the near-field flow appears to be two-dimensional in each transverse plane along the bow.

There is no single control; rather a combination of inputs such as bow-speed, bow pressure, choice of string and even finger position.
He shows how violinists and other string players held their instruments and their bows.
His sonatas show great concern with virtuosity of the bow, alternating sequential patterns with the articulation of ornaments.
Afterward he sees his favorite dancer wiping sweat from her face as she receives his complements with cool bows.

Seemingly paralysed and unprepared, the regency bowed to the inevitable dismissal, and were spared any reprisals.
